intro: Convolvulus gaudichaudii, commonly known as the Hawaiian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant thrives in coastal and dry forest habitats, often growing along rocky areas and lava fields. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, hence its common name. Convolvulus gaudichaudii is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii, making it an important part of the region's flora.
